required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Study of Segmental Renal Artery Clamping During Laparoscopic Partial Nephrectomy
clinical_study.official_title: A Randomized Controlled Trial Comparing the Segmental Artery Clamping and Main Renal Artery Clamping During Laparoscopic Partial Nephrectomy

lead_sponsor.agency: The First Affiliated Hospital with Nanjing Medical University

clinical_study.source: The First Affiliated Hospital with Nanjing Medical University

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to compare the efficacy and safety of the segmental artery clamping and main renal artery clamping during laparoscopic partial nephrectomy

detailed_description.textblock: Renal tumor patients,for whom laparoscopic partial nephrectomy is suitable, will be randomly divided into two groups,segmental artery clamping group and main artery clamping group. All procedures were performed by the same laparoscopic surgeon. Blood loss, operation time, warm ischemia time, complications and affected renal function before and after operation will be recorded and compared. The safety and efficiency of laparoscopic partial nephrectomy with segmental renal artery clamping will be evaluated in comparison with the conventional main renal artery clamping technique.

arm_group.description: Patients with Renal tumor are randomized into this group,they will received laparoscopic partial nephrectomy. During operation, the technique of segmental renal artery clamping will performed.

Patients with renal tumor are randomized into this group,they will received laparoscopic partial nephrectomy. During operation, the technique of traditional main renal artery clamping will be performed.

intervention.description: Laparoscopic partial nephrectomy with segmental artery clamping will be performed for patients enrolled in this group.
Laparoscopic partial nephrectomy with main renal artery clamping technique will be performed for patients enrolled in this group.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- 20＜age＜70yr
- Stage T1a
- Patients volunteered for this study and provided written informed consent
Exclusion Criteria:
- Bilateral renal tumor
- tumor of solitary kidney
- glomerulonephritis
- renal insufficiency
- GFR of invalid kidney less than 30ml/min
- presence of suspect metastasis
- serious systematic disease: severe coagulation disorders
- important organ insufficiency and severe psychological disease

overall_official.affiliation: The First Affiliated Hospital with Nanjing Medical University

facility.name: Department of Urology, First Affiliated Hospital of Nanjing Medical University

reference.citation: Shao P, Tang L, Li P, Xu Y, Qin C, Cao Q, Ju X, Meng X, Lv Q, Li J, Zhang W, Yin C. Precise segmental renal artery clamping under the guidance of dual-source computed tomography angiography during laparoscopic partial nephrectomy. Eur Urol. 2012 Dec;62(6):1001-8. doi: 10.1016/j.eururo.2012.05.056. Epub 2012 Jun 7.

Shao P, Tang L, Li P, Xu Y, Qin C, Cao Q, Ju X, Meng X, Lv Q, Li J, Zhang W, Yin C. Application of a vasculature model and standardization of the renal hilar approach in laparoscopic partial nephrectomy for precise segmental artery clamping. Eur Urol. 2013 Jun;63(6):1072-81. doi: 10.1016/j.eururo.2012.10.017. Epub 2012 Oct 24.

results_reference.citation: Shao P, Qin C, Yin C, Meng X, Ju X, Li J, Lv Q, Zhang W, Xu Z. Laparoscopic partial nephrectomy with segmental renal artery clamping: technique and clinical outcomes. Eur Urol. 2011 May;59(5):849-55. doi: 10.1016/j.eururo.2010.11.037. Epub 2010 Dec 7.

responsible_party.investigator_affiliation: The First Affiliated Hospital with Nanjing Medical University
